content:
• Tuesday, December 6, 2011
  • OPAY

    Tier Technologies (NASDAQ:TIER) moves higher in the post-trading session after its FQ4 beats...

    Tier Technologies (NASDAQ:TIER) moves higher in the post-trading session after its FQ4 beats estimates across the board. The company still racked up losses on a per share basis however, as its bottom line continues to be impacted by major shifts in management, changes in technology direction, and an overhaul to its sales and marketing strategy. Shares +2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 PM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley's (NASDAQ:VRA) Q3 beats estimates as profit more than doubled amid strong indirect...

    Vera Bradley's (NASDAQ:VRA) Q3 beats estimates as profit more than doubled amid strong indirect sales growth, compared with a year-earlier period that was hit by costs tied to the handbag maker's transition to a public company. The company issues a cautious outlook for 2012, now expecting to $0.44- $0.47 EPS on revenues of $125M-$130M, which is on the lower end of estimates. Shares -5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM
  • TLB

    More on Talbots (NYSE:TLB): Sycamore says it made the offer in a letter to Talbots's Chairman...

    More on Talbots (NYSE:TLB): Sycamore says it made the offer in a letter to Talbots's Chairman Gary Pfeiffer, citing concerns with the retailer's operational performance, deep discounting and falling stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • TLB

    Private equity firm Sycamore Partners says it offered $3 per share to acquire Talbots...

    Private equity firm Sycamore Partners says it offered $3 per share to acquire Talbots (NYSE:TLB), an offer the firm is making public after saying it has was rebuffed by the struggling retailer. Shares +71% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM

  • Vitesse (VTSS) FQ4 misses estimates, swinging to a loss for the quarter on weak demand globally....

    Vitesse (VTSS) FQ4 misses estimates, swinging to a loss for the quarter on weak demand globally. The stock is up in after-hours trading however, as investors focus on the strength of the company's 2012 new product cycle. This year the company brought over 20 new products to market, and achieved over 300 of design wins with over 100 of its top-tier customers, more than double the design wins of 2010. Shares +8.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • EXPR

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) drops 2.1% AH after announcing shareholders plan to sell 16M shares in a...

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) drops 2.1% AH after announcing shareholders plan to sell 16M shares in a public offering. Not counting the 2.4M share overallotment option, the offering is equal to 28.5% of Express' current float. (prospectus)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • S

    After opening lower on news of a major stock offering, Clearwire (CLWR) rallied, and finished...

    After opening lower on news of a major stock offering, Clearwire (CLWR) rallied, and finished the day up 11.1%; shares have now doubled from their October lows. Helix Investment is pounding the table for Clearwire: it thinks funding concerns are overblown as long as Clearwire can "hold Sprint (NYSE:S) hostage," and believes a bankruptcy would actually unlock shareholder value, by forcing Clearwire to sell its valuable spectrum.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • EXPR

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) announces a 16M common share secondary offering with an additional option...

    Express (NYSE:EXPR) announces a 16M common share secondary offering with an additional option for another 2.4M. Shares -3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CB

    ACE Limited (ACE +1.5%) finishes higher after being upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Ticonderoga,...

    ACE Limited (ACE +1.5%) finishes higher after being upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Ticonderoga, saying it's one of the best ways to play a turn in the property casualty insurance cycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • TLRD

    Men's Wearhouse (MW) gains 5.3% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $584.6M (+6.3% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Men's Wearhouse (MW) gains 5.3% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $584.6M (+6.3% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.79, beating Street estimates by $13.7M and $0.14. Gross margin was 45.9%, down 130 bps Q/Q but up 315 bps Y/Y. The company expects FQ4 EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.12, slightly worse than a -$0.11 consensus. Sales are expected be up 3.5%-4%, compared with a 4.1% consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers (TOL +2.7%) finishes higher after its FQ4 results beat expectations earlier today,...

    Toll Brothers (TOL +2.7%) finishes higher after its FQ4 results beat expectations earlier today, as the luxury homebuilder posted better revenue on more homes deliveries. Looking to the new fiscal year, the company estimates it will deliver between 2,400 and 3,200 homes at an average price between $550K and $575K per home.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • LOW

    Lowe's (LOW +1.7%) moves up after affirming its FY12 outlook, now expecting to earn $1.37 to...

    Lowe's (LOW +1.7%) moves up after affirming its FY12 outlook, now expecting to earn $1.37 to $1.40 a share. Comparable-store sales should fall 1% while total sales for the year should rise 2% to 3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • NVLS-OLD

    Needham says Novellus Systems' (NVLS-OLD +4.1%) move to lift its Q4 bookings guidance to the...

    Needham says Novellus Systems' (NVLS-OLD +4.1%) move to lift its Q4 bookings guidance to the high end of prior expectations and optimism on order strength confirms its view that the semiconductor equipment space "is in an early stage of a cyclical rebound." The firm boosts its NVLS price target to $40 from $37 and raises its 2012 EPS view.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 Technology (QIHU +3.3%) gains after releasing an official statement to address recent...

    Qihoo 360 Technology (QIHU +3.3%) gains after releasing an official statement to address recent allegations against the company by Citron Research. The company says the Citron report "contains numerous errors of fact and misleading speculations," and asserts that it has a "very unique business model" which is not comparable to the business models of other companies in China or globally.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon (VZ +1.2%) plans to launch a stand-alone service allowing customers to stream movies and...

    Verizon (VZ +1.2%) plans to launch a stand-alone service allowing customers to stream movies and television shows over the Internet, in a new challenge to Netflix (NFLX -1.9%) and traditional cable TV, Reuters reports. VZ is talking with prospective programming partners about the service, which could be launched in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +27.9%) rocket higher following the release of results...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +27.9%) rocket higher following the release of results of a study on its chemotherapy treatment in a step forward for the drug to challenge Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) dominant Avastin. Analysts are backing the prospects for bavituximab with Lifetech Capital's Stephen Dunne saying results parallel those of Avastin and Rothe Capital telling clients it thinks the data point to a survival benefit tied to the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • EGFDF

    European Goldfields (OTC:EGFDF +21%), a developer of mines in Greece, skies after a report of it...

    European Goldfields (OTC:EGFDF +21%), a developer of mines in Greece, skies after a report of it being approached by Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) about a takeover. The move could throw into question plans by Qatar Holding, LLC to buy a stake in Goldfields.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +0.9%) says it's expanded its partnership with Western Beef, an operator of meat,...

    Supervalu (SVU +0.9%) says it's expanded its partnership with Western Beef, an operator of meat, grocery and produce warehouses and supermarkets in New York, New Jersey and Florida, as its primary grocery supplier beginning in January 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • CMEDQ

    Shares of China Medical (CMED -19.5%) plunge after Glaucus Research alleges the medical device...

    Shares of China Medical (CMED -19.5%) plunge after Glaucus Research alleges the medical device maker's CEO "orchestrated an acquisition to embezzle roughly $20-$23 million from the public company." Glaucus says CMED overpaid for the acquisition from an entity it believes is secretly related to the company's CEO. CMED denies the allegations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • KGC

    Canadian gold miner Kinross (KGC +1.9%) gains after saying late yesterday it had reached an...

    Canadian gold miner Kinross (KGC +1.9%) gains after saying late yesterday it had reached an agreement in principle with the government of Ecuador for the development of its Fruta del Norte gold deposit in Ecuador's Zamora Chinchipe province.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • EMN

    BofA weighs in on Eastman Chemical (EMN +1.1%) after meeting with execs with the firm to hear...

    BofA weighs in on Eastman Chemical (EMN +1.1%) after meeting with execs with the firm to hear the case for positive growth in 2012. "Among tailwinds in 2012, Eastman will have the benefit of recent and pending capacity expansions, the full-year benefit of the Sterling acquisition, and stability of earnings in Fibers."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • STI

    SunTrust (STI -6.4%) is one of the S&P's worst performers after CEO William Rogers says...

    SunTrust (STI -6.4%) is one of the S&P's worst performers after CEO William Rogers says mortgage repurchases are rising this quarter, a “very frustrating” process that is “increasingly sort of difficult to predict." Rogers says the Q4 repurchase rate could be elevated and has been eagerly waiting for it to fall, but it looks like the crest remains in the future.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO +2.7%) trades higher after its Rockstar Games subsidiary announces...

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO +2.7%) trades higher after its Rockstar Games subsidiary announces Grand Theft Auto III: 10th Anniversary will be available on the iPhone 4/4S, iPad, and high-end Android devices next week for $5. Grand Theft Auto: Chinatown Wars, released for iOS last year (but not Android), has been well-received.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX -4.4%) fall off after a SEC filing reveals CEO John McCarvel unloaded a...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX -4.4%) fall off after a SEC filing reveals CEO John McCarvel unloaded a small position this week. CROX has traded in a relatively narrow range since a one-day implosion following its Q3 guidance warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • GTY

    Shares of Getty Realty (GTY -8%) are hit hard after Getty Petroleum Marketing, a former unit of...

    Shares of Getty Realty (GTY -8%) are hit hard after Getty Petroleum Marketing, a former unit of Russian oil company Lukoil (OTCPK:LUKOY -5.6%), filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection yesterday. The realty company is trying to end its leasing deal with Getty Petroleum to sublease 800 property units to gas-station operators around the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • RLD

    RealD (RLD -2.6%) is heading lower once again, and a downbeat note from Piper could be playing a...

    RealD (RLD -2.6%) is heading lower once again, and a downbeat note from Piper could be playing a role. While reiterating an Overweight, the firm predicts revenues for 3D film Happy Feet Two may amount to less than half its $165M forecast. It also thinks the performance of Puss in Boots "remains a wild-card."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • FTS

    ITC Holdings (ITC -4.7%) trades lower after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral earlier...

    ITC Holdings (ITC -4.7%) trades lower after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, saying its proposed transmission merger with Entergy (ETR -1%) will be a structural overhang on profit into 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • STCN

    Shares of ModusLink Global Solutions (MLNK +11%) jump to their highest intraday levels since...

    Shares of ModusLink Global Solutions (MLNK +11%) jump to their highest intraday levels since June 2009 after shareholder Handy & Harman Ltd. bought 498,000 shares of the supply-chain management firm on Dec. 1, according to an SEC filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -3.4%) receives a generally positive credit report from Fitch, which says the...

    Jefferies (JEF -3.4%) receives a generally positive credit report from Fitch, which says the firm has "clearly established that it has sufficient liquidity" to navigate "a challenging market environment." Unlike MF Global, "none of [JEF’s] sovereign exposures are off-balance sheet nor based on significant proprietary positions, and the firm does not use credit-default swaps to hedge."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -2.1%) resumes trading, giving back most of its gain following the announcement...

    Dendreon (DNDN -2.1%) resumes trading, giving back most of its gain following the announcement of the sale of its royalty interest in Victrelis for $125M. The sale appears to be a move to raise cash as sales of its prostrate treatment Provenge are running slower than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • LOGM

    LogMeIn (LOGM +4%) moves up after RBC Capital raises its price target on the shares, noting the...

    LogMeIn (LOGM +4%) moves up after RBC Capital raises its price target on the shares, noting the cloud-computing software maker is one of its favorite On Demand names and it likes its scaleable user platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • DNDN

    Biotech Dendreon (DNDN UNCH) is halted upon announcement of an agreement to sell its royalty...

    Biotech Dendreon (DNDN UNCH) is halted upon announcement of an agreement to sell its royalty interest in hepatitis C medication Victrelis  for $125M. The stock leaped just shy of 5% in the moments before the halt. Shares are to resume trading at 1:05 ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences (EXAS -4.1%) dips after pricing its previously announced 3.12M share public...

    Exact Sciences (EXAS -4.1%) dips after pricing its previously announced 3.12M share public offering at $8.00 per share, a 4.6% discount to yesterday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • AAL

    Shares of bankrupt AMR (AMR +70.8%) rocket higher, possibly stemming from an SEC filing in which...

    Shares of bankrupt AMR (AMR +70.8%) rocket higher, possibly stemming from an SEC filing in which AMR appraised its $1B 7.5% Senior Secured Notes Offering and determined a value of collateral at ~$1.52B, 50% above the value of the Notes. While shares soar today, AMR has warned against assigning any value to the common stock. AMR also announces leadership changes. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • AGO

    Shares of Assured Guaranty (AGO +4.4%) tack on another tidy gain, a day after gaining 8.7% on...

    Shares of Assured Guaranty (AGO +4.4%) tack on another tidy gain, a day after gaining 8.7% on the strength of an analyst upgrade. Today's actions could be tied in part to a ratings boost from S&P on securities insured by the firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • FAF

    First American Financial (FAF +7.5%) says it will no longer pursue an acquisition of CoreLogic...

    First American Financial (FAF +7.5%) says it will no longer pursue an acquisition of CoreLogic (CLGX +0.1%), according to an SEC filing. FAF had suggested CLGX sell certain non-core businesses, which it offered to purchase, and said it could purchase the company if the real estate processor and data service provider deemed it best to sell itself entirely.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • VMC

    Though off its highs for the day, Vulcan Materials (VMC +3.6%) is still outperforming thanks to...

    Though off its highs for the day, Vulcan Materials (VMC +3.6%) is still outperforming thanks to takeover chatter. The Fly on the Wall notes aggressive buying of Dec. calls at strike prices of 33 and 34.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • ADS

    Alliance Data Systems (ADS -2.5%) trades lower after being downgraded to Neutral at Piper...

    Alliance Data Systems (ADS -2.5%) trades lower after being downgraded to Neutral at Piper Jaffray following its assumtion of coverage on the stock. Piper cites valuation for the Neutral rating, saying the company's fundamentals are solid, but the stock is overvalued at present levels after gaining nearly 58% over the past year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • GSVC

    Barron’s picked GSV Capital (GSVC +3.3%) as a way for investors to access Facebook, Zynga,...

    Barron’s picked GSV Capital (GSVC +3.3%) as a way for investors to access Facebook, Zynga, Twitter and other promising IPO candidates, but Tim Savageaux sees a potential shortable upside move in the "poster child for inflated late-stage social networking and clean tech valuations." After Monday's +6% move, Savageaux suggests a short position over $16.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -2.6%) dips after the FDA sets a goal date of April 2012 for a decision...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -2.6%) dips after the FDA sets a goal date of April 2012 for a decision on its New Drug Application of pixantrone, a treatment for relapsed or refractory aggressive non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that the company resubmitted in October 2011. The drug is also under evaluation by regulators in Europe, and the Committee for Human Medicinal Products is set to release its decision in January 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • PKG

    Packaging Corp. of America (PKG -1%) slips after being initiated at Credit Suisse with a tepid...

    Packaging Corp. of America (PKG -1%) slips after being initiated at Credit Suisse with a tepid Neutral rating. The firm says the cardboard box manufacturer routinely ranks among the top performers within the containerboard industry, with above average growth potential, but at current levels it's fully valued.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • MTL

    Shares of Mechel Steel (NYSE:MTL) fall 13.3% after the Russian mining and steel firm reports the...

    Shares of Mechel Steel (NYSE:MTL) fall 13.3% after the Russian mining and steel firm reports the suspension of work at several facilities in Siberia by local authorities. The company says most of the requirements set by a monitoring agency have now been met, and it expects to resume normal production within a few days.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -8.5%) sells off after seeing the first of a series of IPO lock-up expirations....

    Fusion-io (FIO -8.5%) sells off after seeing the first of a series of IPO lock-up expirations. The next big expiration arrives on Dec. 19. The expiration comes on top of the extra share supply provided by a recent follow-on offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • PDCE

    Petroleum Development (PETD +2.1%) gains after being initiated with a Buy at Brean Murray. The...

    Petroleum Development (PETD +2.1%) gains after being initiated with a Buy at Brean Murray. The firm says results from the driller's Wattenburg and Marcellus fields continue to improve, and recent non-core divestitures will give the company the cash it needs to fund further development and expand margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • ALLT

    Allot Communications (ALLT +2.6%) trades higher after Jefferies initiates the shares with a Buy...

    Allot Communications (ALLT +2.6%) trades higher after Jefferies initiates the shares with a Buy on valuation. Additionally, RBC raises its price target to $20, noting the stock is an attractive takeover target for other networking companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • JPM

    Bank stocks (XLF -0.2%), so resilient yesterday despite the S&P mass downgrade threat, are...

    Bank stocks (XLF -0.2%), so resilient yesterday despite the S&P mass downgrade threat, are struggling today. Oddly, JPMorgan Chase (JPM -1.2%), widely considered the strongest U.S. bank, is down while Bank of America (BAC +1.2%) is up. Regional banks are especially shaky: STI -4.3%, RF -2.9%. Mark Gongloff suspects today's moves are a "natural cool-down" after yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 4 Comments
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy (HELE +5.2%) moves up after agreeing to buy Procter & Gamble's (NYSE:PG) PUR...

    Helen of Troy (HELE +5.2%) moves up after agreeing to buy Procter & Gamble's (NYSE:PG) PUR water purification business for an undisclosed sum. The acquisition includes all assets, the world-wide PUR trademark, its current and future product lines plus more than 200 patents.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI -10.2%) gets hammered by a downgrade to Neutral from Cowen's Doug Creutz, who thinks...

    THQ (THQI -10.2%) gets hammered by a downgrade to Neutral from Cowen's Doug Creutz, who thinks weak sales of the company's uDraw kids' graphics tablet, and the price concessions THQ will have to make as as result, will lead the game developer to miss its calendar Q4 guidance. Creutz is also slashing his FY13 EPS forecast from $0.49 to just $0.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ASTE

    Astec Industries (ASTE +2.8%) trades higher after Sterne Agee launches coverage on the maker of...

    Astec Industries (ASTE +2.8%) trades higher after Sterne Agee launches coverage on the maker of road-building equipment with a Buy and $40 PT. While noting ongoing uncertainty about federal highway funding, the firm is pleased with Astec's efforts to diversify its revenue base, and to increase its international presence.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT -3%) dips on a valuation downgrade to Neutral from Outperform at Baird. The firm...

    Fortinet (FTNT -3%) dips on a valuation downgrade to Neutral from Outperform at Baird. The firm says the stock has become fully valued due to a recent rally on takeover speculation, but still remains one of its favorite picks in an attractive sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • MSFT

    More love for LinkedIn (LNKD +4.5%) this morning (earlier), as J.P. Morgan hikes its rating to...

    More love for LinkedIn (LNKD +4.5%) this morning (earlier), as J.P. Morgan hikes its rating to Overweight and BofA repeats its Buy rating while raising estimates. Although shares have slipped 20% since Nov. 3, JPM says "the company has shown strong operational performance... deeper corporate penetration and increasing member engagement will drive strong results going forward."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • SAVE

    Shares of Spirit Airlines (SAVE -8.5%) fall off after the firm files with the SEC (S-1) for a...

    Shares of Spirit Airlines (SAVE -8.5%) fall off after the firm files with the SEC (S-1) for a $172.5M shelf offering - marking a relatively large sale in relation to the firm's market cap of just over $1B.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • HUN

    Shares of Huntsman (HUN -3.6%) get clipped after taking on a downgrade from Jefferies to Hold...

    Shares of Huntsman (HUN -3.6%) get clipped after taking on a downgrade from Jefferies to Hold from Buy. Also weighing in on the bearish side is a designation from TheStreet.com as "Today's Featured Chemical Loser" due to the firm's "unimpressive growth in net income, poor profit margins and weak operating cash flow."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • QADMF

    Don't think mining shares are cheap? Poland's state-owned KGHM - the world's 9th largest copper...

    Don't think mining shares are cheap? Poland's state-owned KGHM - the world's 9th largest copper producer - inks an all-cash deal to buy Canada's Quadra Mining (OTC:QADMF +37%) for $3B. Quatra shares are trading higher than the $15 bid in Toronto, suggesting the possibility of a bidding war? (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO -5.1%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Outperform at Credit Suisse, a day...

    Tesoro (TSO -5.1%) shares are downgraded to Neutral from Outperform at Credit Suisse, a day after it held a meeting with analysts. Analyst Edward Westlake says Tesoro offers substantial upside, but adds, "we still find more upside at peers" such as Marathon Petroleum (MPC -0.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • LQDT

    Shares of Liquidity Services (LQDT -13.4%) sink after the firm misses the consensus EPS estimate...

    Shares of Liquidity Services (LQDT -13.4%) sink after the firm misses the consensus EPS estimate of analysts by $0.05 with its FQ4 report on revenue of $79M (+12.8% Y/Y) . The firm takes a "cautious" tone for FY12, saying it expects EPS to fall in a range of $1.26-$1.32.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • OWW

    Orbitz (OWW +10.5%) shares surge after Benchmark hikes its rating to Buy from Hold, with a new...

    Orbitz (OWW +10.5%) shares surge after Benchmark hikes its rating to Buy from Hold, with a new price target of $5 from $3. The bullish stance reflects "stable global hotel demand, accelerating profit from the e-bookers European hotel operation, contribution from private label partnerships and the ensuing inflection of cash flow EBITDA to sustainable growth.”

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • TMUS

    William Blair raises its rating on MetroPCS (PCS +3.4%) to Outperform, saying the wireless...

    William Blair raises its rating on MetroPCS (PCS +3.4%) to Outperform, saying the wireless provider's current valuation does not reflect its fundamentals and healthy balance sheet. "With historical seasonality, distracted competition and the anticipated decline in 2012 smartphone handset prices all working in MetroPCS’s favor," Blair sees improved performance in Q4 and 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM

  • The price of cocoa continues to fall back as chocolate manufacturers see demand in Europe wane...

    The price of cocoa continues to fall back as chocolate manufacturers see demand in Europe wane with all the financial unrest. After hitting a 33-year high last year due to a supply disruption from political unrest in the Ivory Coast, prices have now retreated back 42% and look set to stay low with forecasts projecting that supplies will outpace demand for the next season. Cocoa futures -1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • GE

    GE +1.2% premarket as Sanford C. Bernstein raises its recommendation to Outperform and lifts its...

    GE +1.2% premarket as Sanford C. Bernstein raises its recommendation to Outperform and lifts its price target to $21 from $19, citing rising dividends and energy orders starting in 2012. The Fed will complete its review of GE Capital in the first half of next year and likely allow it to resume its dividend, Bernstein says.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) -18.4% premarket as it says the FDA extends the goal date...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) -18.4% premarket as it says the FDA extends the goal date for approving its new drug application for taliglucerase alfa, a treatment for Gaucher disease, to May 1 from Feb. 1. Protalix says no additional data was requested by the FDA, nor was the company notified of any specific deficiency in the application.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview: S&P futures +0.2% but paring gains after S&P places the AAA rating of...

    Market preview: S&P futures +0.2% but paring gains after S&P places the AAA rating of the European rescue fund on "creditwatch negative," adding to its decision for the eurozone yesterday. Interestingly, while Spanish and French 10-year bond yields are are up, Italy's are lower. European bourses are off slightly; Asian markets are lower. Frontline +29% on its decision to split into two.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) says study results show combining its bavituximab antibody with...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) says study results show combining its bavituximab antibody with chemotherapy treatment improved the overall tumor response rate in lung cancer patients, 39% vs. a 26% response in patients who only received the chemotherapy drugs. PPHM +28% premarket. (PR)
